intro: Saffordiella bennigseniana, commonly known as the Bennigsen's saffordiella, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
